oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Duke of Paducah war bond event
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: World War II-era event hosted by [Unidentified] and Duke of Paducah with two performances by Dick Stearns and His Orchestra [phonetic]. Song selections include "Be Careful, It's My Heart," written by Irving Berlin, and a medley of songs written by George M. Cohan.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Dick Stearns and His Orchestra [phonetic] performs the opening theme and [Unidentified] announces the opening statements / (1:07) Dick Stearns and His Orchestra perform "Be Careful, It's My Heart," with vocals by Don Haggard / (4:36) Host thanks performers, introduces Don Lee McKiernan [phonetic] / (5:04) Don introduces Duke of Paducah / (5:47) Duke of Paducah talks about bonds, introduces the Coast Guard Cutters / (7:48) Coast Guard Cutters perform a medley of George M. Cohan tunes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Cohan, George M. (George Michael), 1878-1942
